text: Seguenzia elegans is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Seguenziidae. ==Description== The size of the shell varies between 3 mm and 4.3 mm. The base is perforated or umbilicated. The fissure of the outer lip is close to the suture. The columella is produced below. The aperture is broadly truncately sinuous on the base.Tryon (1887), Manual of Conchology IX – Solariidae (by William B. Marshall), Ianthinidae, Trichotropidae, Scalariidae, Cerithiidae, Rissoidae, Littorinidae ==Distribution== This species occurs in the Atlantic Ocean off the Bay of Biscay, Madeira, Bermuda and Argentine. ==References== * Gofas, S.; Le Renard, J.; Bouchet, P. (2001). Mollusca, in: Costello, M.J. et al. (Ed.) (2001). European register of marine species: a check-list of the marine species in Europe and a bibliography of guides to their identification. Collection Patrimoines Naturels, 50: pp. 180–213 ==External links== * elegans Category:Gastropods described in 1885
title: Seguenzia elegans
